content: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Twin tailwinds are helping Ryanair to weather its pilot crisis. The 20 billion euro no-frills airline will meet its full-year profit goal  despite a rostering mess that led to the cancellation of thousands of flights. Passenger numbers were up 11 percent to 72.1 million in the six months to Sept. 30  according to Tuesday’s half-year report from the company. Ryanair’s fare cuts helped  but it also got lucky with rivals’ bankruptcies.
name: Ryanair Holdings plc
title: Breakingviews - Twin tailwinds help Ryanair weather pilot crisis

content: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Ryanair is living down to its cheapskate reputation. The budget airline is facing irate passengers and an angry regulator after cancelling more than 20 000 flights over the coming seven months. This combination could be an existential threat for most companies. For the Irish carrier  however  indifference to customers is an integral part of its discount offering.

content: PARIS  Feb 2 European stock index futures inched higher on Monday  with the airline sector in focus after Ryanair raised its profit forecast.     Ryanair  Europe's largest airline by passenger numbers  lifted its profit forecast for the third time in as many months  as costs fell and traffic grew  but it cautioned that profit growth will be modest next year as rivals' cheaper fuel push fares down.      At 0738 GMT  futures for Euro STOXX 50  for Germany's DAX  and for France's CAC we
name: Ryanair Holdings plc
title: Europe Factors to Watch-Shares set to inch up; Ryanair eyed
